metadata.title: Transforming Crossroads or Obfuscating Pathways: A Hermeneutical-Theological Exploration of Ontotheology and Alterity in Emmanuel Falque
metadata.author: N/A

content.full_text:
Transforming Crossroads or Obfuscating Pathways: A Hermeneutical-Theological Exploration of Ontotheology
Transforming Crossroads or Obfuscating Pathways: A Hermeneutical-Theological Exploration of Ontotheology
and Alterity in Emmanuel Falque
and Alterity in Emmanuel Falque
A Data Management Plan created using DMPonline.be
Creator: 
Creator: 
Rohan Vinu Abraham
Affiliation: 
Affiliation: 
KU Leuven (KUL)
Funder: 
Funder: 
Fonds voor Wetenschappelijk Onderzoek - Research Foundation Flanders (FWO)
Template: 
Template: 
FWO DMP (Flemish Standard DMP)
Grant number / URL: 
Grant number / URL: 
11PH224N
ID: 
ID: 
206295
Start date: 
Start date: 
01-11-2023
End date: 
End date: 
31-10-2027
Project abstract:
Project abstract:
Ontotheology has been considered a significant problem in theology for decades. Despite this, Emmanuel Falque dismisses ontotheology and aims to
philosophize beyond its specter. In this project, I aim to explore to what extent Emmanuel Falque has absolved himself from the perils of Ontotheology
through different phases of his work. This leads to a hermeneutical theological exploration that programmatically takes place through Falque’s works,
starting from his treatment of the doctrine of the Incarnation in his Triduum Philosophique, his treatment of ontotheology, specifically in the works of
Bonaventure, his treatment of the theme of alterity in patristic and medieval theologians, and finally the implications he draws for the relationship
between philosophy and theology. Through a hermeneutical theological examination of Falque’s works, the project aims to expose the theological pre-
understandings that Falque brings to his phenomenological readings and subsequently clarify ontotheological problems in his texts. In doing so, the
project uncovers a new paradigm through which ontotheology can be understood and dealt with anew. Consequently, the project draws implications of
this new paradigm for philosophical theology and the philosophy
and phenomenology of religious experience.

Last modified: 
23-04-2024

I will avail the automatic backup feature offered by KU Leuven Onedrive. I will reguarly make and update backups of my work in my personal
data storage hard drives alongside the KU Leuven Onedrive backups.

make use of the secured access provided to me under that system.

clean_full_text: Transforming Crossroads or Obfuscating Pathways: A Hermeneutical-Theological Exploration of Ontotheology Transforming Crossroads or Obfuscating Pathways: A Hermeneutical-Theological Exploration of Ontotheology and Alterity in Emmanuel Falque and Alterity in Emmanuel Falque A Data Management Plan created using DMPonline.be Creator: Creator: Rohan Vinu Abraham Affiliation: Affiliation: KU Leuven (KUL) Funder: Funder: Fonds voor Wetenschappelijk Onderzoek - Research Foundation Flanders (FWO) Template: Template: FWO DMP (Flemish Standard DMP) Grant number / URL: Grant number / URL: 11PH224N ID: ID: 206295 Start date: Start date: 01-11-2023 End date: End date: 31-10-2027 Project abstract: Project abstract: Ontotheology has been considered a significant problem in theology for decades. Despite this, Emmanuel Falque dismisses ontotheology and aims to philosophize beyond its specter. In this project, I aim to explore to what extent Emmanuel Falque has absolved himself from the perils of Ontotheology through different phases of his work. This leads to a hermeneutical theological exploration that programmatically takes place through Falque’s works, starting from his treatment of the doctrine of the Incarnation in his Triduum Philosophique, his treatment of ontotheology, specifically in the works of Bonaventure, his treatment of the theme of alterity in patristic and medieval theologians, and finally the implications he draws for the relationship between philosophy and theology. Through a hermeneutical theological examination of Falque’s works, the project aims to expose the theological pre- understandings that Falque brings to his phenomenological readings and subsequently clarify ontotheological problems in his texts. In doing so, the project uncovers a new paradigm through which ontotheology can be understood and dealt with anew. Consequently, the project draws implications of this new paradigm for philosophical theology and the philosophy and phenomenology of religious experience.
